response: "Why can't I just be myself? Society's expectations are suffocating me, and I feel like I'm losing touch with who I really am."
"I'm constantly bombarded with images of flawless beauty and success. It's driving me insane, making me question my worth and abilities."
"I'm so tired of trying to live up to impossible standards. It's like I'm on a never-ending treadmill, always striving for perfection but never feeling good enough."
"Every time I see someone else's seemingly perfect life on social media, I feel like a failure. It's like I'm trapped in this distorted reality that I can't escape."
"I don't understand why I have to conform to society's idea of perfection. It's exhausting constantly trying to fit in and be what others expect me to be."
